FuncDef:
The site default command displays the default VSI-BGP-SITE view.
By default, no VSI-BGP-SITE view is displayed.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In VPLS multi-homing scenarios where a CE is single-homed to a PE, after the pwsignal bgp multi-homing command is run, the system automatically generates a default multi-homing site for the single-homed PE. After the default multi-homing site is generated, run the site default command to enter the default VSI-BGP-SITE view.
Prerequisites
VPLS multi-homing has been enabled using the pwsignal bgp multi-homing command.An RD has been configured for the VSI using the route-distinguisher (VSI-BGP view) command.

Follow-up Procedure
Run the site-id site-id command to configure a multi-homing site ID.
Precautions
The site default command applies only to VPLS multi-homing scenarios where a CE is single-homed to a PE.
The active delay-time, and recover delay-time commands used for configuring link protection between the CE and PE cannot be used.Because only one multi-homing site exists, the best-site command cannot be used.
